SENT.plain: The case of a 35 years old female patient is here reported
Her previous medical records included repeated miscarriages and ischaemic ulcers in the right leg
She developed thrombosis at the left common femoral artery with serum antiphospholipid antibodies
The patient was treated with anticoagulants and two months later developed multiorganic failure
She was successfully managed with plasmapheresis, high dose prednisone, and anticoagulants
The clinical picture was considered to be a catastrophic antiphospholipid syndrome
